title: How to Send One Message to Multiple Contacts on WhatsApp (Android & iOS)

steps.title: Tap the Chats tab at the bottom of WhatsApp.
steps.content: Tap the Chats tab at the bottom of WhatsApp. It's at the bottom of the screen and looks like two speech bubbles. [1] X Research source A broadcast list allows you to send a message to multiple contacts, with each conversation appearing as its own thread. By using a broadcast list, you can send the same message to multiple people without starting a group chat. Recipients will not know you've sent the same message to others.

steps.title: Tap the green + (plus) button.
steps.content: Tap the green + (plus) button. It’s located at the top-right corner of the screen when you’re in the Chats tab. Tapping the + button will open the New chat menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select New broadcast.
steps.content: Select New broadcast . It’s in the New chat menu at the bottom of the first section, below the Chat with AIs option. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Choose all the contacts you want to message.
steps.content: Choose all the contacts you want to message. When you tap New broadcast , a complete list of your contacts will open. Scroll up and down the list and tap the name of any contact you want to include in the broadcast list. Tapping a contact will add a green and white check mark to the circle next to their name, and you can select up to 256 contacts. [4] X Research source Only contacts with your number in their address book can be added to your broadcast list. The contacts you select will not know that you've added them to a broadcast list.

steps.title: Tap Create.
steps.content: Tap Create . It's at the top-right corner of the screen. This saves the broadcast list and creates a new message.

steps.title: Type your message and tap the Send icon.
steps.content: Type your message and tap the Send icon. You can enter your message into the white text field on the screen. The Send icon is the green and white paper airplane near the bottom-right corner. This sends the same message to all of the contacts you've added to the broadcast list. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Access broadcast messages from the Settings tab.
steps.content: Access broadcast messages from the Settings tab. In addition to the Chats tab, you can also navigate to the Settings tab, which is on the bottom-right corner of the screen next to Chats. Once in Settings, tap Broadcast messages , and you’ll see a list of all the broadcast messages you’ve created; you can tap on each one to access them. [6] X Research source At the bottom of this page, you’ll also see the New list option. If you prefer, you can create new broadcast lists from here!

steps.title: Tap the ⁝ (Menu) icon in WhatsApp.
steps.content: Tap the ⁝ (Menu) icon in WhatsApp. It's in the Chats tab. You’ll see the icon at the top-right corner of the screen; it looks like three stacked dots. [7] X Research source A broadcast list allows you to send a message to multiple contacts, with each conversation appearing as its own thread. By using a broadcast list, you can send the same message to multiple people without starting a group chat. Recipients will not know you've sent the same message to others.

steps.title: Tap New broadcast in the dropdown menu.
steps.content: Tap New broadcast in the dropdown menu. A list of your contacts will appear. Keep in mind that only contacts with your number in their address book will receive your broadcast messages. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select the contacts you want to add to the broadcast list.
steps.content: Select the contacts you want to add to the broadcast list. Tapping a contact will add a green and white check mark to the circle next to their name. You can select up to 256 contacts. [9] X Research source The contacts you select won’t know you've added them to a broadcast list.

steps.title: Tap the green check icon to finalize the broadcast list.
steps.content: Tap the green check icon to finalize the broadcast list. This saves your broadcast list with the selected contacts and creates a new chat so you can send your broadcast message. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Type your message and tap the Send button.
steps.content: Type your message and tap the Send button. Enter your message into the white text field on the screen. The Send button is the green and white paper airplane at the bottom-right corner of the screen. This sends the same message to all of the contacts you've added to the broadcast list.

steps.title: Tap the Chats tab in WhatsApp.
steps.content: Tap the Chats tab in WhatsApp. It's the two overlapping chat bubbles near the bottom-right corner of the screen. [11] X Research source Group chats allow you to send messages to multiple people at one time. Group members can see and respond to any messages sent to the group.

steps.title: Tap the green + (plus) button to open the new chat menu.
steps.content: Tap the green + (plus) button to open the new chat menu. It looks like a white plus sign with a green background; you’ll find it at the top-right corner of the screen. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Select the New group option.
steps.content: Select the New group option. It's at the top of the list (below the Search bar) in the New chat menu.

steps.title: Choose contacts to add to the group message.
steps.content: Choose contacts to add to the group message. Tapping a contact will add a green and white check mark to the circle next to their name (and, of course, include them in the new group). You can select up to 1,024 contacts to add to the group. When you’re ready to proceed, tap Next at the top-right corner of the screen. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a subject or name for the group.
steps.content: Enter a subject or name for the group. The group chat’s subject can be up to 25 characters long. Choose anything that suits the group’s purpose, whether you’re using it to send important information or just chat with a specific bunch of friends. [14] X Research source If you'd like to assign an icon representing the chat, tap the camera icon at the top-left corner and select an image from your phone or tablet.

steps.title: Tap Create.
steps.content: Tap Create . On the same page where you enter a group subject, you’ll see the Create option at the top-right corner of the screen. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Type your message and send it.
steps.content: Type your message and send it. To start typing, tap the white typing area at the bottom of the screen. When you’re ready to send it, just press the Send icon (a green and white paper airplane) at the bottom right corner of the screen. Group members can remove themselves from a group chat at any time. Messages from blocked users will still appear in group chats.

steps.title: Tap the “New chat” icon in WhatsApp.
steps.content: Tap the “New chat” icon in WhatsApp. In the Chats tab (which you can select at the bottom of the screen), you’ll see a speech bubble icon with a plus sign (+) in the top-right corner of the screen. This is the New chat icon! [16] X Research source Group chats allow you to send messages to multiple people at one time. Group members will be able to see and respond to any messages sent to the group.

steps.title: Tap New group in the “New chat” menu.
steps.content: Tap New group in the “New chat” menu. Selecting New group will open a new menu with your contacts list. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Select contacts to add
steps.content: Select contacts to add . You can add up to 1,024 contacts to the group. When you select a contact, the circle beside their name will fill with a green and white check mark.

steps.title: Tap the green arrow icon.
steps.content: Tap the green arrow icon. Pressing the arrow icon (→) saves the member list for your new group chat. Note that group members can remove themselves from a group chat anytime, while broadcast list recipients must remove you from their address book to stop receiving your messages. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Type a subject for the group, then tap the green checkmark.
steps.content: Type a subject for the group, then tap the green checkmark. The group's subject (or name) is the label that’ll appear in Chats so you can tell which chat you’re pulling up. It can be up to 25 characters long. When you’re ready to officially create the group chat, select the green checkmark at the top-right corner of the screen. If you'd like to assign an icon to represent the chat, tap the camera icon at the top-left corner and select an image from your phone or tablet.

steps.title: Type your message and tap the Send icon.
steps.content: Type your message and tap the Send icon. To start typing, tap the white typing area at the bottom of the screen. Then, when your message is ready to send, press the green and white paper airplane icon (the Send icon) at the bottom-right corner of the screen. This will send the message to all group members. [19] X Research source Messages from blocked users will still appear in group chats.

steps.title: Open the chat containing the message you want to forward.
steps.content: Open the chat containing the message you want to forward. You'll find existing chats in the Chats tab; just select the chat and scroll to the message you want to forward. Use this method to forward one message from any chat to up to five different contacts! [20] X Research source This method will work on any Android, iPhone, or iPad. If you take screenshots of funny or interesting things from chats to share with others, this method offers you a less labor-intensive way to do it.

steps.title: Tap and hold the message you want to forward.
steps.content: Tap and hold the message you want to forward. After a second or so, a series of icons will appear at the top of the screen. [21] X Research source You can also forward multiple messages by tapping additional messages after you press and hold on the first one.

steps.title: Tap the Forward icon at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the Forward icon at the top of the screen. This will open your list of contacts. However, the Forward icon looks slightly different depending on your platform: [22] X Research source iOS: A curved arrow with a hollow interior; you’ll also see “Forward” to the left of it Android: A curved arrow with two points

steps.title: Select up to five contacts.
steps.content: Select up to five contacts. If you need to send the message to more than five people, just repeat the steps in this method after forwarding the first five. An individual chat will be started with each member. Note that forwarded messages are labeled as such, so don’t use this method if you don’t want recipients to know the message has been forwarded. You can even forward someone else's message to multiple people. The original sender will not be notified.

steps.title: Tap Send or Forward.
steps.content: Tap Send or Forward . The option you’ll see depends on your version of WhatsApp. Either way, after this, the message will be delivered to the selected recipients. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Set up WhatsApp Web on your computer.
steps.content: Set up WhatsApp Web on your computer. Connecting WhatsApp to your web browser is quick and easy. This wikiHow article has you covered if you run into any issues! These steps can also be carried out within the WhatsApp mobile app, although copying and pasting your messages will be much more tedious without a computer.

steps.title: Write a message to a contact of your choice and send it.
steps.content: Write a message to a contact of your choice and send it. Once WhatsApp Web is set up, you should see your current conversations within the interface. You can also create a new conversation with any of your contacts. Find or start a conversation and write up a message. Because the message is going to multiple people, you can alternatively copy and paste it before sending it. It’s up to you, depending on whether it’s a time-sensitive message.

steps.title: Copy the message and paste it into other chats.
steps.content: Copy the message and paste it into other chats. Double-click or click and drag the message to highlight it and press Ctrl + C (Windows) or Command + C (iOS) to copy the message. Then, find or start the conversations with other intended recipients; in each chat thread, press Ctrl + V (Windows) or Command + V (iOS) to paste the message. Finally, hit Enter to send it! This method is not the most efficient, but it can be a decent option if you don't plan on sending messages to multiple contacts often and don’t feel like creating a whole broadcast list.

steps.title: How many contacts can you add to a WhatsApp group chat?
steps.content: How many contacts can you add to a WhatsApp group chat? You can add up to 1,024 contacts to a group chat in WhatsApp if you’re an admin.

steps.title: Can you send multimedia files (photos and videos) with broadcast lists?
steps.content: Can you send multimedia files (photos and videos) with broadcast lists? Yes, you can! It’s possible to send photos, videos, and documents using broadcast lists.

steps.title: Can you customize the settings for who can post in group chats?
steps.content: Can you customize the settings for who can post in group chats? Yes, if you’re an admin for a group chat, you can choose who’s allowed to make posts—“Only Admins” (so only group admins can send messages) or “All participants” (meaning everyone in the group can send messages).

steps.title: Are there restrictions on forwarding messages?
steps.content: Are there restrictions on forwarding messages? The main restriction is the number of contacts you can forward a message to simultaneously—the limit is 5. You can forward the same message as many times as you want, but you’ll have to do it in groups of 5 contacts.
